captions.text: - Here's a question for you Caitlin.

- Yes.
- Do women or men place more emphasis

on physical attractiveness
when selecting mates?
- That's a stupid question.
- I think probably girls are
more attracted to good looks.

- I strongly disagree with that.
- Yeah?

- I feel like I know
tons of guys who will...

when they describe their
dream girl, it's just looks.
- Because there's a lot of beautiful women
out there with ugly dudes.
- But do these money not have money?

We should also think about that.
(laughs)
- I've definitely dated girls where
I had nothing in common with them

but they were just so
attractive that I could...
- You're really tooting your own horn.
- I've always heard that girls are like...
sometimes they'll date guys and
they're like, "oh, I can change him."
- There's just more categories for a woman

to feel like somebody
is a complete partner.
- So what you're saying is that you have
this perfect picture in your mind of
who the perfect person would be for you.
- No, but that is scary.
- Well, this is a sad fact of biology.
- Wait, what?

- Female brains are wired
to be attracted to different

traits during different
times of their monthly cycle.
- Oh no, that doesn't sound good.
- So when women are more fertile,
they're more likely to be attracted
to guys with more masculine features
and when they're less fertile,
they're more attracted to guys with...
- Scientists.
- Less masculine features.
- Oh man, so that's why you date jerks.
- I don't date jerks.
- Oh, this just got personal, whoa.
- I didn't say that.
You don't date jerks?
- Oh my god.
- So, a cross-cultural study showed
that regardless of body weight,

guys prefer girls that have
a 0.7 waist to hip ratio.
- What does that even mean?
- If your hips are one, your waist is 0.7.
The reason that's true is women that
have that ratio can have more babies.
Hips don't lie.

- Yeah, yeah you know what
else doesn't lie though?

- What?
- Ferrari.
So a 2011 study, showed that women were
more likely to choose guys who flaunted

their luxury items as
their short-term partners.
So you might want wear
a nice watch in your profile guys.
- No, no!
- It makes sense.
- What does it mean?
- I don't know, I don't know what I have.
- This is what I'll say...
Guys, I always look their shoes first,
not to see how expensive they are
but to make sure they're not gross.

- She, see.
- You have to have nice shoes.
- So, they want the hourglass?
- It's not our fault it's biology.
(Sighs) That's bull (beep).

- Liar.
(laughs)
- We're both just animals.
- Just aminals.

title: Do Men Or Women Care More About Looks?

comments.text:
Statistics drawn from dating websites show that women actually care more 
about looks than men do.﻿

comments.author: ashley galvin

comments.text:
Personally, men who flaunt their wealth are probably the biggest turn-off 
to me. I am a very practical person and see no justifiable reason to spend 
lots of money for certain brands or going out for lavish dates all the 
time. I've been on dates with wealthy men and I usually feel very 
uncomfortable about people buying me things (although I have no problem 
buying for others if I can afford it). And as the for physical features, I 
find myself going more for chubby guys or guys with really long or dark 
hair (ponytail length). The biggest turn on for me is intelligence. My 
boyfriend has super long hair, is very tall, and chubby and has an IQ of 
120, which he definitely puts to use. plus we're both stoners, creative 
types, and very curious and imaginative.﻿

comments.text:
Let me get this straight? Y'all believe to get into a relationship and not 
be attracted to the person at all? Physical wise? That is so dumb, 
honestly. Of course women like "masculine" guys, and guys like "petite" 
women. I don't blame either one for having likes and dislikes. BUT 
personality plays a big part of it too, what do you mean? You going to date 
a extremely physically attractive but extremely annoying person? Nah man. 
That's I really don't believe people who say they only date people for 
their personality or looks. What people don't like is when men see women as 
walking sex objets, or when women date men because of the money they have 
(these are the most sterotyped). Human attraction is complicated and a lot 
of it goes not only looks, but how they smell and sound, the way they walk, 
talk. Thats why confident people are percieved as more attracted they have 
that exra oomph. Everyone would rather date a confident person than someone 
they have to be saying they love them every 5 minutes. The whole social 
media and new technology and time changes the way on what we think is 
attractive or not. 


Also of effing course both genders are saying that the oppisite gender 
cares more about looks? Who wants to admit that you are shallow? 

Also I don't give a damn about my spelling or grammar. It's 2 am in the 
effing morning. ﻿

comments.text:
+Katie Torres Don't think I don't sympathise ,and you are right I cant 
completely empathise because I have the wrong set of bits.
I agree that society hasn't yet tipped entirely away from the impossible 
standards for the female form but it is getting there, and equality is a 
worthwhile fight. As long as it goes both ways. There are some double 
standards still held on both sides.
When I say guys feel more pressure its because girls place more importance 
on external appearance full stop, whether it be worrying about their own or 
judging potential partners. 

I didn't expect a reply, I'm afraid I just felt I needed to voice my 
experience, so thank you for taking the time. Please don't see this as an 
argument, because if you do you probably won.

comments.author: TheCraftCousins

comments.text:
i guess that's pretty fast... im usually up and ready in 10 mins but that 
only means a bite of breakfast, uniform, fix hair and brush teeth. If I 
really want to take my time (which 4 out of 7 days a week that I can take 
my time), I take a 10-20 min bathroom activities (everything I need to do 
in the bathroom), cook and eat breakfast, and prep myself up properly.  All 
in all, 1 hour at most.
